A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Visually rich with glimmers of hope cannot save what feels more like a tongue-in-cheek Marvel superhero flick\, as opposed to a \"Star Wars\" movie. The film is too long\, it tries way too hard and it ultimately betrays the very mythology he leans upon for levity and support. If this is the new direction Disney wants to take the \"Star Wars\" franchise\, count me out. Maybe Luke's right: It's time for the Jedi to end.
